a: Karma is action. Do your duty without attachment to results; this purifies the mind and leads to peace (Gita 2.47).
Dharma is your right action rooted in your nature and role. Better to do your own duty imperfectly than another's perfectly (Gita 18.47).
Through practice and detachment (abhyasa and vairagya). The mind can be a friend or an enemy depending on discipline (Gita 6.5–6.6).

q: What is yoga in the Gita?
a: Yoga is equanimity and skill in action—maintaining steadiness while performing duties with devotion (Gita 2.48, 2.50).
